contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Italian comune | name = Quintano | official_name = Comune di Quintano | native_name = | image_skyline = | imagesize = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_shield = | shield_alt = | image_map = | map_alt = | map_caption = | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_alt = | latd = 45 |latm = 25 |lats = |latNS = N | longd = 9 |longm = 37 |longs = |longEW = E | coordinates_type = type:city(783)_region:IT | coordinates_display = title | coordinates_footnotes = | region = [[Lombardy]] | province = [[Province of Cremona]] (CR) | frazioni = | mayor_party = | mayor = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 2.8 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 783 | population_as_of = Dec. 2004 | pop_density_footnotes = | population_demonym = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | twin1 = | twin1_country = | saint = | day = | postal_code = 26027 | area_code = 0373 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Quintano''' is a ''[[comune]]'' (municipality) in the [[Province of Cremona]] in the [[Italy|Italian]] region [[Lombardy]], located about 35 km east of [[Milan]] and about 45 km northwest of [[Cremona]]. As of 31 December 2004, it had a population of 783 and an area of 2.8 kmÂ².<ref name="istat">All demographics and other statistics: Italian statistical institute [[National Institute of Statistics (Italy)|Istat]].</ref> Quintano borders the following municipalities: [[Capralba]], [[Casaletto Vaprio]], [[Pieranica]], [[Torlino Vimercati]], [[Trescore Cremasco]]. == Demographic evolution ==
